str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To cause to appear, make visible. From a derivative of phaino; to make apparent, i.e. to appear.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Fearful, dreadful, terrible. From phobos; frightful, i.e. formidable.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Trembling with fear, terrified. From en and tromos; terrified.
Greatly terrified, horrified. From ek and phobos; frightened out of one's wits: sore afraid, exceedingly fear.
